metadata.title: CVE-2018-5094 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow vulnerability may occur in WebAssembly when"shrinkElements" is called followed by garbage collection on memory that isnow uninitialized. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
